title: RVD#1470 vim before patch 8.0.0056 does not properly validate values for 'filetype', 'syntax' and 'keymap' options
description: vim before patch 8.0.0056 does not properly validate values for the 'filetype', 'syntax' and 'keymap' options, which may result in the execution of arbitrary code if a file with a specially crafted modeline is opened.

flaw.detected-by: Victor Mayoral Vilches and Lander Usategui San Juan (Alias Robotics)
flaw.reported-by: James McCoy (original bug), Alias Robotics S.L.

exploitation.description: Execution of arbitrary code if a file with a specially crafted modeline is opened.

title: RVD#1469 The email module in Various Versions of Python 2 and 3 wrongly parses email addresses that contain multiple @ characters.
description: An issue was discovered in Python through 2.7.16, 3.x through 3.5.7, 3.6.x through 3.6.9, and 3.7.x through 3.7.4. The email module wrongly parses email addresses that contain multiple @ characters. An application that uses the email module and implements some kind of checks on the From/To headers of a message could be tricked into accepting an email address that should be denied. An attack may be the same as in CVE-2019-11340; however, this CVE applies to Python more generally.

flaw.detected-by: Victor Mayoral Vilches and Lander Usategui San Juan (Alias Robotics)
flaw.reported-by: Cyril Nicodème (Original bug), Alias Robotics S.L.

exploitation.description: An application that uses the email module and implements some kind of checks on the From/To headers of a message could be tricked into accepting an email address that should be denied

title: RVD#1468 http.cookiejar.DefaultPolicy.domain_return_ok in Python before 3.7.3 can be tricked into sending existing cookies to the wrong server.
description: http.cookiejar.DefaultPolicy.domain_return_ok in Lib/http/cookiejar.py in Python before 3.7.3 does not correctly validate the domain it can be tricked into sending existing cookies to the wrong server. An attacker may abuse this flaw by using a server with a hostname that has another valid hostname as a suffix (e.g., pythonicexample.com to steal cookies for example.com). When a program uses http.cookiejar.DefaultPolicy and tries to do an HTTP connection to an attacker-controlled server, existing cookies can be leaked to the attacker. This affects 2.x through 2.7.16, 3.x before 3.4.10, 3.5.x before 3.5.7, 3.6.x before 3.6.9, and 3.7.x before 3.7.3.

flaw.detected-by: Victor Mayoral Vilches and Lander Usategui San Juan (Alias Robotics)

exploitation.description: When a program uses http.cookiejar.DefaultPolicy and tries to do an HTTP connection to an attacker-controlled server, existing cookies can be leaked to the attacker

title: RVD#1467 Some python versions 2.7/3.7. are vulnerable to DoS via catastrophic backtracking
description: python before versions 2.7.15, 3.4.9, 3.5.6rc1, 3.6.5rc1 and 3.7.0 is vulnerable to catastrophic backtracking in the difflib.IS_LINE_JUNK method.  An attacker could use this flaw to cause denial of service.

flaw.detected-by: Victor Mayoral Vilches and Lander Usategui San Juan (Alias Robotics)
flaw.reported-by: James Davis (Original Bug), Alias robotics S.L.

exploitation.description: the catastrophic backtracking in the difflib.IS_LINE_JUNK method can be leveraged to cause the application to crash.

title: RVD#1466 glibc allows specially crafted LD_LIBRARY_PATH values to manipulate the heap/stack
description: glibc contains a vulnerability that allows specially crafted LD_LIBRARY_PATH values to manipulate the heap/stack, causing them to alias, potentially resulting in arbitrary code execution. Please note that additional hardening changes have been made to glibc to prevent manipulation of stack and heap memory but these issues are not directly exploitable, as such they have not been given a CVE. This affects glibc 2.25 and earlier.

flaw.detected-by: Victor Mayoral Vilches and Lander Usategui San Juan (Alias Robotics)
flaw.reported-by: Petr Matousek (original bug), Alias Robotics S.L.

exploitation.description: If heap and stack memory regions were adjacent to each other, an attacker could use this flaw to jump over the heap/stack gap, cause controlled memory corruption on process stack or heap, and thus increase their privileges on the system.

title: RVD#1465 getchar.c in Vim before 8.1.1365 and Neovim before 0.3.6 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary OS commands
description: getchar.c in Vim before 8.1.1365 and Neovim before 0.3.6 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary OS commands via the :source! command in a modeline, as demonstrated by execute in Vim, and assert_fails or nvim_input in Neovim.

flaw.detected-by: Victor Mayoral Vilches and Lander Usategui San Juan (Alias Robotics)
flaw.reported-by: James McCoy (original bug), Alias Robotics S.L.

exploitation.description: Arbitrary code execution OS commands via the :source! command in a modeline and assert_fails or nvim_input in Neovim.

title: RVD#3323 Mismanaged permission implementation leads to privilege escalation, exfiltration of sensitive information, and DoS
description: the main user account has restricted privileges but is in the sudoers group and there is not any mechanism in place to prevent sudo su or sudo -i to be run gaining unrestricted access to sensible files, encryption, or issue orders that disrupt robot operation.
system: xArm5 Lite v1.5.0 and before, xArm6, xArm7

flaw.detected-by: Alfonso Glera (Alias Robotics)

exploitation.description: Not disclosed

title: RVD#1464 CRLF injection is possible due to an issue discovered in urllib2 in Python 2.x through 2.7.16 and urllib in Python 3.x through 3.7.3.
description: An issue was discovered in urllib2 in Python 2.x through 2.7.16 and urllib in Python 3.x through 3.7.3. CRLF injection is possible if the attacker controls a url parameter, as demonstrated by the first argument to urllib.request.urlopen with \r\n (specifically in the query string after a ? character) followed by an HTTP header or a Redis command.

flaw.detected-by: Victor Mayoral Vilches and Lander Usategui San Juan (Alias Robotics)
flaw.reported-by: Guo Xi chen, Jiang Hang (original bug), Alias Robotics S.L.

exploitation.description: The current implementation of urllib does not encode the \u2018\r\n\u2019 sequence in the query string, which allowed the attacker to manipulate a HTTP header with the \u2018\r\n\u2019 sequence in it, so the attacker could insert arbitrary content to the new line of the HTTP header.

title: RVD#1463 The OpenSSL RSA Key generation algorithm is vulnerable to a cache timing side channel attack
description: The OpenSSL RSA Key generation algorithm has been shown to be vulnerable to a cache timing side channel attack. An attacker with sufficient access to mount cache timing attacks during the RSA key generation process could recover the private key. Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.0i-dev (Affected 1.1.0-1.1.0h). Fixed in OpenSSL 1.0.2p-dev (Affected 1.0.2b-1.0.2o).

flaw.detected-by: Victor Mayoral Vilches and Lander Usategui San Juan (Alias Robotics)
flaw.reported-by: Alejandro Cabrera Aldaya, Billy Brumley, Cesar Pereida Garcia and Luis Manuel Alvarez Tapia (original bug); Alias Robotics S.L.

exploitation.description: An attacker with sufficient access to mount cache timing attacks during the RSA key generation process could recover the private key

title: RVD#1462 The shared memory manager in sshd in OpenSSH before 7.4 does not ensure that a bounds check is enforced by all compilers
description: The shared memory manager (associated with pre-authentication compression) in sshd in OpenSSH before 7.4 does not ensure that a bounds check is enforced by all compilers, which might allows local users to gain privileges by leveraging access to a sandboxed privilege-separation process, related to the m_zback and m_zlib data structures.

flaw.detected-by: Victor Mayoral Vilches and Lander Usategui San Juan (Alias Robotics)
flaw.reported-by: Damien Miller (original issue), Alias Robotics S.L.

exploitation.description: sshd in OpenSSH before 7.4 does not ensure that a bounds check is enforced by all compilers, which might allows local users to gain privileges by leveraging access to a sandboxed privilege-separation process, related to the m_zback and m_zlib data structures.

title: RVD#1461 Integer overflow in the strxfrm function in the GNU C Library before 2.21 allows to cause a DoS
description: Integer overflow in the strxfrm function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.21 allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a long string, which triggers a stack-based buffer overflow.

flaw.detected-by: Victor Mayoral Vilches and Lander Usategui San Juan (Alias Robotics)

exploitation.description: The strxfrm function in the GNU C Library can be subjected an integer overflow attack resulting in a crash

title: RVD#1460 Untrusted search path vulnerability in ssh-agent.c in OpenSSH before 7.4 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary local PKCS#11 modules
description: Untrusted search path vulnerability in ssh-agent.c in ssh-agent in OpenSSH before 7.4 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary local PKCS#11 modules by leveraging control over a forwarded agent-socket.

flaw.detected-by: Victor Mayoral Vilches and Lander Usategui San Juan (Alias Robotics)
flaw.reported-by: Jann Horn (original bug), Alias Robotics S.L.

exploitation.description: No checks are performed on the provider name, if a user connects to a malicious SSH server with agent forwarding enabled and the malicious server has the ability to place a file with attacker-controlled contents in the victim's filesystem, the SSH server can execute code on the user's machine.

title: RVD#1459 Use-after-free vulnerability in bzip2 1.0.6 allows remote attackers to cause a DoS
description: Use-after-free vulnerability in bzip2recover in bzip2 1.0.6 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted bzip2 file, related to block ends set to before the start of the block.

flaw.detected-by: Victor Mayoral Vilches and Lander Usategui San Juan (Alias Robotics)

exploitation.description: By means of a crafted bzip2 file a use-after-free vulnerability could be exploited in bzip2recover triggering a Crash

title: RVD#1458 idn in GNU libidn before 1.33 might allow remote attackers to obtain sensitive memory information
description: idn in GNU libidn before 1.33 might allow remote attackers to obtain sensitive memory information by reading a zero byte as input, which triggers an out-of-bounds read.

flaw.detected-by: Victor Mayoral Vilches and Lander Usategui San Juan (Alias Robotics)

exploitation.description: reading a zero byte as input in idn, which triggers an out-of-bounds read sharing sensitive data.

title: RVD#1457 An invalid memory address dereference in elfutils through v0.174. that allows attackers to cause a DoS
description: An invalid memory address dereference was discovered in dwfl_segment_report_module.c in libdwfl in elfutils through v0.174. The vulnerability allows attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) with a crafted ELF file.

flaw.detected-by: Victor Mayoral Vilches and Lander Usategui San Juan (Alias Robotics)

exploitation.description: Using a crafted ELF file the application can be lead to a DoS via invalid memory address dereference under dwfl_segment_report_module.c on libdwfl

title: RVD#1456 Stack-based buffer overflow in the getaddrinfo function in getaddrinfo.c in glibc allows a DoS attack
description: Stack-based buffer overflow in the getaddrinfo function in sysdeps/posix/getaddrinfo.c in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via vectors involving hostent conversion. NOTE this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2013-4458.

flaw.detected-by: Victor Mayoral Vilches and Lander Usategui San Juan (Alias Robotics)
flaw.reported-by: Florian Weimer (original bug), Alias Robotics S.L.

exploitation.description: When converting a struct hostent response to struct gaih_addrtuple, the gethosts macro (which is called from gaih_inet) uses alloca, without malloc fallback for large responses.  This code path is used with AF_INET and AF_INET6 queries, not AF_UNSPEC queries.

title: RVD#1455 A buffer overflow in glibc 2.5 which can be triggered through the LD_LIBRARY_PATH environment variable
description: A buffer overflow in glibc 2.5 (released on September 29, 2006) and can be triggered through the LD_LIBRARY_PATH environment variable. Please note that many versions of glibc are not vulnerable to this issue if patched for CVE-2017-1000366.

flaw.detected-by: Victor Mayoral Vilches and Lander Usategui San Juan (Alias Robotics)

exploitation.description: Buffer overflow in glibc's ld.so. Researchers discovered a memory leak and a buffer overflow in the dynamic loader (ld.so) of the GNU C Library (glibc). See https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/43331 for a PoC available.

title: RVD#3322 Weak authentication implementation make the system vulnerable to a brute-force attack over adjacent networks
description: The authentication implementation on the xArm controller has very low entropy, making it vulnerable to a brute-force attack. There is no mechanism in place to mitigate or lockout automated attempts to gain access.
system: xArm5 Lite v1.5.0 and before, xArm6, xArm7

flaw.detected-by: Alfonso Glera (Alias Robotics)

exploitation.description: Not disclosed

title: RVD#1454 Double free vulnerability in JasPer 1.900.17 allows remote attackers to cause a DoS
description: Double free vulnerability in the jasper_image_stop_load function in JasPer 1.900.17 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted JPEG 2000 image file.

flaw.detected-by: Victor Mayoral Vilches and Lander Usategui San Juan (Alias Robotics)

exploitation.description: By means of a crafted file the jasper_image_stop_load function can be used to trigger a crash

title: RVD#1453 Python 2.7.14 is vulnerable to a Heap-Buffer-Overflow as well as a Heap-Use-After-Free
description: Python 2.7.14 is vulnerable to a Heap-Buffer-Overflow as well as a Heap-Use-After-Free. Python versions prior to 2.7.14 may also be vulnerable and it appears that Python 2.7.17 and prior may also be vulnerable however this has not been confirmed. The vulnerability lies when multiply threads are handling large amounts of data. In both cases there is essentially a race condition that occurs. For the Heap-Buffer-Overflow, Thread 2 is creating the size for a buffer, but Thread1 is already writing to the buffer without knowing how much to write. So when a large amount of data is being processed, it is very easy to cause memory corruption using a Heap-Buffer-Overflow. As for the Use-After-Free, Thread3->Malloc->Thread1->Free's->Thread2-Re-uses-Free'd Memory. The PSRT has stated that this is not a security vulnerability due to the fact that the attacker must be able to run code, however in some situations, such as function as a service, this vulnerability can potentially be used by an attacker to violate a trust boundary.

flaw.detected-by: Victor Mayoral Vilches and Lander Usategui San Juan (Alias Robotics)
flaw.reported-by: Víctor Mayoral Vilches <victor@aliasrobotics.com>, Stinner Victor (original bug affecting Python)

exploitation.description: Heap-Buffer-Overflow as well as a Heap-Use-After-Free vulnerabilities allow the control of multiple registers

title: RVD#1452 Memory leak in the __res_vinit function in the IPv6 name server code in libresolv in glibc before 2.24 causes a DoS
description: Memory leak in the __res_vinit function in the IPv6 name server management code in libresolv in GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.24 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) by leveraging partial initialization of internal resolver data structures.

flaw.detected-by: Victor Mayoral Vilches and Lander Usategui San Juan (Alias Robotics)

exploitation.description: The sockaddr_in6 allocated in resolv/res_init.c is not freed, leaking 28 bytes per thread using the resolver

title: RVD#1451 There is an overflow bug in the AVX2 Montgomery multiplication procedure
description: There is an overflow bug in the AVX2 Montgomery multiplication procedure used in exponentiation with 1024-bit moduli. No EC algorithms are affected. Analysis suggests that attacks against RSA and DSA as a result of this defect would be very difficult to perform and are not believed likely. Attacks against DH1024 are considered just feasible, because most of the work necessary to deduce information about a private key may be performed offline. The amount of resources required for such an attack would be significant. However, for an attack on TLS to be meaningful, the server would have to share the DH1024 private key among multiple clients, which is no longer an option since CVE-2016-0701. This only affects processors that support the AVX2 but not ADX extensions like Intel Haswell (4th generation). Note --> The impact from this issue is similar to CVE-2017-3736, CVE-2017-3732 and CVE-2015-3193. OpenSSL version 1.0.2-1.0.2m and 1.1.0-1.1.0g are affected. Fixed in OpenSSL 1.0.2n. Due to the low severity --> of this issue we are not issuing a new release of OpenSSL 1.1.0 at this time. The fix will be included in OpenSSL 1.1.0h when it becomes available. The fix is also available in commit e502cc86d in the OpenSSL git repository.

flaw.detected-by: Victor Mayoral Vilches and Lander Usategui San Juan (Alias Robotics)

exploitation.description: Attacks against RSA and DSA as a result of this defect would be very difficult to perform and are not believed likely. Attacks against DH1024 are considered just feasible, because most of the work necessary to deduce information about a private key may be performed offline. The amount of resources required for such an attack would be significant.

title: RVD#1450 Integer overflow in the GNU C Library before 2.22 allows context-dependent attackers to cause a DoS
description: Integer overflow in the _IO_wstr_overflow function in libio/wstrops.c in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.22 allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via vectors related to computing a size in bytes, which triggers a heap-based buffer overflow.

flaw.detected-by: Victor Mayoral Vilches and Lander Usategui San Juan (Alias Robotics)

exploitation.description: The _IO_wstr_overflow function in libio/wstrops.c in libc6 can be attacked by performing a integer overflow, thus triggering a Crash.

title: RVD#1449 OoB Write will cause Mozilla Network Security Services to crash on various iterations from 3.21.4 to 3.30.1
description: Mozilla Network Security Services (NSS) before 3.21.4, 3.22.x through 3.28.x before 3.28.4, 3.29.x before 3.29.5, and 3.30.x before 3.30.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds write) or possibly have unspecified other impact by leveraging incorrect base64 operations.

flaw.detected-by: Victor Mayoral Vilches and Lander Usategui San Juan (Alias Robotics)

title: RVD#1448 The glob function in glob.c in the GNU C Library contains a buffer overflow unescaping names with ~ operator.
description: The glob function in glob.c in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.27 contains a buffer overflow during unescaping of user names with the ~ operator.

flaw.detected-by: Victor Mayoral Vilches and Lander Usategui San Juan (Alias Robotics)

exploitation.description: GLOB_TILDE unescaping causes buffer overflow.

title: RVD#1447 Carry propagating bug in the Broadwell-specific Montgomery multiplication procedure in OpenSSL 1.0.2 and 1.1.0 before 1.1.0cspecific Montgo
description: There is a carry propagating bug in the Broadwell-specific Montgomery multiplication procedure in OpenSSL 1.0.2 and 1.1.0 before 1.1.0c that handles input lengths divisible by, but longer than 256 bits. Analysis suggests that attacks against RSA, DSA and DH private keys are impossible. This is because the subroutine in question is not used in operations with the private key itself and an input of the attacker's direct choice. Otherwise the bug can manifest itself as transient authentication and key negotiation failures or reproducible erroneous outcome of public-key operations with specially crafted input. Among EC algorithms only Brainpool P-512 curves are affected and one presumably can attack ECDH key negotiation. Impact was not analyzed in detail, because pre-requisites for attack are considered unlikely. Namely multiple clients have to choose the curve in question and the server has to share the private key among them, neither of which is default behavior. Even then only clients that chose the curve will be affected.

flaw.detected-by: Victor Mayoral Vilches and Lander Usategui San Juan (Alias Robotics)
flaw.reported-by: Unai Ayucar Carbajo, Richard Morgan (original bug)

exploitation.description: Among EC algorithms only Brainpool P-512 curves are affected and one presumably can attack ECDH key negotiation

title: RVD#1446 A heap buffer overflow in the TFTP receiving code allows for DoS
description: A heap buffer overflow in the TFTP receiving code allows for DoS or arbitrary code execution in libcurl versions 7.19.4 through 7.64.1.

flaw.detected-by: Victor Mayoral Vilches and Lander Usategui San Juan (Alias Robotics)
flaw.reproducibility: The flaw exists if the user selects to use a "blksize" of 504 or smaller (default is 512). The smaller size that is used, the larger the possible overflow becomes.

exploitation.description: The function (tftp_receive_packet()) that recevives data from a TFTP server calls recvfrom() with the default size for the buffer rather than with the size that was used to allocate it.

title: RVD#1444 RTDE Interface allows unauthenticated reading of robot data and unauthenticated writing of registers and outputs
description: CB3 SW Version 3.3 and upwards, e-series SW Version 5.0 and upwards allow authenticated access to the RTDE (Real-Time Data Exchange) interface on port 30004 which allows setting registers, the speed slider fraction as well as digital and analog Outputs. Additionally unautheticated reading of robot data is also possible
system: Universal Robots Robot Controllers CB 3.1 SW Version 3.3 and upwards, e-series SW version 5.0 and upwards

flaw.detected-by: Bernhard Dieber, Benjamin Breiling (and many others)
flaw.reported-by: Bernhard Dieber, Benjamin Breiling (and many others)

exploitation.description: Not disclosed
